parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF: 11240002) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for campaign finance reporting and are mandatory for candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions and promotes the National Liberal Party (PNL).  It directly calls for voters to vote for the PNL to continue their work. The post also identifies the author as Mircea Minea, who is the mayor of Chiajna and likely a candidate or affiliated with a candidate in the upcoming elections. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. The use of Facebook as a platform further supports this. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to persuade voters to support the PNL. The phrases "Trebuie să votăm Partidul Național Liberal" (We must vote for the National Liberal Party) and "pentru a continua împreună tot ce ne-am propus" (to continue together everything we have proposed) explicitly aim to influence voting behavior. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it presents a partisan appeal for votes.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>While the post expresses the author's opinion, it's not a personal opinion in the sense of a casual expression. It's a carefully crafted message designed to sway public opinion and influence voting behavior, making it electoral propaganda.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2041957979608071</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers directly to a political party (PNL), is used in a period likely after the official campaign period (judging by the date), has a clear electoral objective (persuading voters to vote for PNL), and is addressed to the wide public via a paid Facebook advertisement. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The argument that it's the mayor's personal opinion is weak, as the post is clearly designed as a political advertisement.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Mircea Minea</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>PNL</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Entitatea responsabilă de postare], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (ID postare: 2041957979608071), care promovează Partidul Național Liberal (PNL) și pe Mircea Minea, cu scopul clar de a influența votul alegătorilor. Postarea conține îndemnuri explicite la vot pentru PNL ("Trebuie să votăm Partidul Național Liberal"), utilizează un număr CMF (11240002), și este adresată publicului larg prin intermediul unei reclame plătite pe Facebook, constituind astfel propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie. Efectul electoral este evident, având în vedere conținutul explicit al postării și distribuirea acesteia pe o platformă socială cu o mare audiență.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
